string.name: edevlet_info
string.html: Please use the transcript document you obtained from E-Devlet. Otherwise, an error will occur.

resources.string: \t\tYour opinions about UniSaver are very valuable to us. Please share your reviews, good or bad.
Report Errors and Your Thoughts to Us
If you have experienced an error while calculating with your transcript, please provide your transcript as well. We cannot fix the error without seeing itâ€¦
When you have completed the array, press the \"Done\" button below.
\t\tUniSaver application is designed to be a quick and easy way to calculate your GPA.\n \t\tThe operations you can perform in this application and their explanations:\n
\t\tAfter entering the GPA and credit information (except new term info) you can add courses to the table and perform calculations.\n

\t\tIn the same way, after entering your GPA and credit information, enter the courses you want to calculate and click \"Done\". You can set the calculation restrictions and view the calculated combinations.\n

\t\tYou can easily perform any operations you want with your transcript document (.pdf) that you received from E-Devlet. The application creates a table with your courses. You can apply the operations of adding course, deleting course and changing the grade of an existing course on the table.\n

\t\tThe letter grade array that you can use in operations numbered 1 to 2 is stored in the name of \"Application System\". You can also go to the section where you can customize letter grades from the menu section on the home page for different grades.\n\t\tWe also undertake that no action will be taken regarding your personal information in the documents.\n
The course named %1$s had grade %2$s, now has new grade %3$s.\n
The course with %1$d credits and grade of %2$s has new letter grade of %3$s.
The credits of the courses those have previous letter grades cannot exceed the total credits.
If you wish, you can enter the course again.

There cannot be two systems with the same name.

GPA, must fit to letter array bounds.
Please enter the credit and it cannot be less than 0.
There cannot be a grade with the same name!
Please do not enter very high values!
